intro: Galearia stenophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leafed globemallow, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are often clustered in spherical inflorescences, giving it its common name. Galearia stenophylla is adapted to withstand drought and has a deep root system for water storage.
